title: White Paper: The State of Social Media Research APIs & Tools in the DSA Era
snippet: Fabio Giglietto co-authored a white paper exploring the impact of the Digital Services Act (DSA) on data access for platform research. This may have generated press coverage.
description: A white paper, co-authored by Fabio Giglietto, explores the impact of the Digital Services Act (DSA) on data access for platform research. This content is highly relevant to his expertise in social media research and disinformation studies.

title: VERAAI Project Developing AI-Based Tools to Combat Disinformation
snippet: Fabio Giglietto is involved in the EU-funded Horizon Europe project VERAAI, which develops AI tools for fact-checking and combating disinformation.  News outlets may have covered this project and quoted him.

title: How to Detect a Disinformation Campaign - Media Ecosystems Analysis Group
snippet: Fabio Giglietto, associate professor at the University of Urbino, is interviewed about his work in the field of misinformation, focusing on how actors respond to social media platforms' attempts to crack down on coordinated behavior. His research on COVID-19 mis- and disinformation in Italy is mentioned, with findings applicable to a wider variety of content.
description: This podcast interview features Fabio Giglietto, an associate professor at the University of Urbino, discussing his work on misinformation, including his research on COVID-19 disinformation in Italy and actors' responses to platform crackdowns on coordinated behavior.

title: The persistence and resilience of misinformation in the face of fact checking - Vera.ai
snippet: Fabio Giglietto, along with Massimo Terenzi and Richard Rogers, facilitated a project at the Digital Media Initiative (DMI) Winter School at the University of Amsterdam titled “The Persistence and Resilience of Misinformation in the Face of Fact Checking”. The project's results, which enrich the scientific work of vera.ai's work package 4.4, were presented at a poster session on January 12th, 2024.
description: This article discusses Fabio Giglietto's involvement in a project at the Digital Media Initiative (DMI) Winter School focused on misinformation and fact-checking, which was presented in January 2024.
